title: Jekyll Static Site Generator config file schema

values.title: Front Matter Default Values
values.description: Values that are set for the given scope. Can be overridden in the files front matter.

layout.title: The layout to use.
layout.description: A file from the directory specified by `layouts_dir`

permalink.title: Permalink Format
permalink.description:
Permalinks are the output path for your pages, posts, or collections.
They allow you to structure the directories of your source code different from the directories in your output.

output.title: Let Jekyll render the collection output

sort_by.title: Sort documents by front matter key

order.title: Manually order documents as listed
order.description: If `sort_by` metadata key has also been defined properly, `order` list takes precedence.

source.title: Site Source
source.description: Change the directory where Jekyll will read files

destination.title: Site Destination
destination.description: Change the directory where Jekyll will write files

safe.title: Safe
safe.description: Disable custom plugins, and ignore symbolic links

exclude.title: Exclude
exclude.description: Exclude directories and/or files from the conversion. These exclusions are relative to the site's source directory and cannot be outside the source directory.

include.title: Include
include.description: Force inclusion of directories and/or files in the conversion. `.htaccess` is a good example since dotfiles are excluded by default.

keep_files.title: Keep files
keep_files.description: When clobbering the site destination, keep the selected files. Useful for files that are not generated by jekyll; e.g. files or assets that are generated by your build tool. The paths are relative to the `destination`.

timezone.title: Time Zone
timezone.description:
Set the time zone for site generation. This sets the `TZ` environment variable, which Ruby uses to handle time and date creation and manipulation. Any entry from the IANA Time Zone Database is valid, e.g. `America/New_York`.
When serving on a local machine, the default time zone is set by your operating system. But when served on a remote host/server, the default time zone depends on the server's setting or location.

encoding.title: Encoding
encoding.description:
Set the encoding of files by name (only available for Ruby 1.9 or later). The default value is `utf-8` starting in 2.0.0, and `nil` before 2.0.0, which will yield the Ruby default of `ASCII-8BIT`. Available encodings can be shown by the command `ruby -e 'puts Encoding::list.join("
")'`.

future.title: Future
future.description: Publish posts or collection documents with a future date.

unpublished.title: Unpublished
unpublished.description: Render posts that were marked as unpublished.

lsi.title: LSI
lsi.description: Produce an index for related posts. Requires the `classifier-reborn` plugin.

limit_posts.title: Limit Posts
limit_posts.description: Limit the number of posts to parse and publish.

incremental.title: Incremental build
incremental.description: Enable the experimental incremental build feature. Incremental build only re-builds posts and pages that have changed, resulting in significant performance improvements for large sites, but may also break site generation in certain cases.

profile.title: Liquid profiler
profile.description: Generate a Liquid rendering profile to help you identify performance bottlenecks.

strict_front_matter.title: Strict Front Matter
strict_front_matter.description: Cause a build to fail if there is a YAML syntax error in a page's front matter.

baseurl.title: Base URL
baseurl.description:
Serve the website from the given base URL.

For a site designed to be mounted at URL `https://example.com/`, the recommended values are nil, '' or '/'.
For a site designed to be mounted at URL `https://example.com/blog/`, the recommended values are just 'blog', '/blog', or '/blog/'

livereload.title: Live Reload
livereload.description: Reload a page automatically on the browser when its content is edited.

detach.title: Detach
detach.description: Detach the server from the terminal.

collections_dir.title: Collections Dir
collections_dir.description: Directory to store all your collections in the same place.

show_dir_listing.title: Allow directory listing
show_dir_listing.description: Only works locally. GitHub ignores it.

auto_id_prefix.title: Prefix used for automatically generated header IDs

auto_id_stripping.title: Strip all formatting from header text for automatic ID generation

coderay_bold_every.title: Defines how often a line number should be made bold

coderay_css.title: Defines how the highlighted code gets styled

coderay_default_lang.title: Sets the default language for highlighting code blocks

coderay_line_number_start.title: The start value for the line numbers

coderay_line_numbers.title: Defines how and if line numbers should be shown

coderay_tab_width.title: The tab width used in highlighted code

coderay_wrap.title: Defines how the highlighted code should be wrapped

footnote_backlink.title: Defines the text that should be used for the footnote backlinks
footnote_backlink.description:
The footnote backlink is just text, so any special HTML characters will be escaped.

If the footnote backlint text is an empty string, no footnote backlinks will be generated.

footnote_backlink_inline.title: Specifies whether the footnote backlink should always be inline
footnote_backlink_inline.description: With the default of false the footnote backlink is placed at the end of the last paragraph if there is one, or an extra paragraph with only the footnote backlink is created.

footnote_nr.title: The number of the first footnote
footnote_nr.description: This option can be used to specify the number that is used for the first footnote.

gfm_quirks.title: Enables a set of GFM specific quirks

header_offset.title: Sets the output offset for headers
header_offset.description: If this option is c (may also be negative) then a header with level n will be output as a header with level c+n. If c+n is lower than 1, level 1 will be used. If c+n is greater than 6, level 6 will be used.

html_to_native.title: Convert HTML elements to native elements

line_width.title: Defines the line width to be used when outputting a document

link_defs.title: Pre-defines link definitions
link_defs.description: Values are two element Arrays with the link URL and the link title

math_engine.title: Set the math engine
math_engine.description: Specifies the math engine that should be used for converting math blocks/spans. If this option is set to `nil`, no math engine is used and the math blocks/spans are output as is.

math_engine_opts.title: Set the math engine options
math_engine_opts.description: Specifies options for the math engine set via the math_engine configuration option.

parse_block_html.title: Process kramdown syntax in block HTML tags

parse_span_html.title: Process kramdown syntax in span HTML tags

smart_quotes.title: Defines the HTML entity names or code points for smart quote output
smart_quotes.description: The entities identified by entity name or code point that should be used for, in order, a left single quote, a right single quote, a left double and a right double quote are specified by separating them with commas.

syntax_highlighter.title: Set the syntax highlighter
syntax_highlighter.description: Specifies the syntax highlighter that should be used for highlighting code blocks and spans. If this option is set to `nil`, no syntax highlighting is done.

syntax_highlighter_opts.title: Set the syntax highlighter options
syntax_highlighter_opts.description: Specifies options for the syntax highlighter set via the syntax_highlighter configuration option.

toc_levels.title: Defines the levels that are used for the table of contents
toc_levels.description: The individual levels can be specified by separating them with commas (e.g. 1,2,3) or by using the range syntax (e.g. 1..3). Only the specified levels are used for the table of contents.

transliterated_header_ids.title: Transliterate the header text before generating the ID

typographic_symbols.title: Defines a mapping from typographical symbol to output characters
typographic_symbols.description: Typographical symbols are normally output using their equivalent Unicode codepoint. However, sometimes one wants to change the output, mostly to fallback to a sequence of ASCII characters.

webrick.title: WEBrick Options
webrick.description: You can provide custom headers for your site.
